snippet: The vote torpedoed President Obama’s push to expand his trade negotiating power, and probably his chance to secure a legacy-defining trade accord spanning the Pacific Ocean.
abstract: House Democrats vote down worker assistance program in order to thwart legislation granting president broad trade negotiation powers and possibly obstruct completion of Trans-Pacific Partnership; house Republicans, unable to muster enough support to pass bill without Democrats, pass stand-alone bill granting trade negotiation powers, which cannot go to president since Senate version of bill combines both measures.
lead_paragraph: The vote torpedoed President Obama’s push to expand his trade negotiating power, and probably his chance to secure a legacy-defining trade accord spanning the Pacific Ocean.

headline.main: House Rejects Trade Measure, Rebuffing Obama’s Dramatic Appeal
headline.print_headline: House Democrats Spurn Obama, Endangering Trade Pact
